alert.note: Alert for Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 4:57AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A narrow line of downpours with gusty winds will impact portions of Ulster, Schenectady, northwestern Dutchess, Columbia, Albany, Greene, southeastern Saratoga, southeastern Schoharie and Rensselaer Counties through 545 AM EST... At 456 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking downpours with gusty winds along a line extending from Clifton Park to Grahamsville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Poughkeepsie, Rotterdam, Kingston, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Scotia, New Paltz, Hudson, Mechanicville, Ellenville, Catskill, Saugerties and Hoosick Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 7, and between exits 8A and 10. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
